results.title: Hollywood Costume: What is Costume Design? with Prof. D. Nadoolman Landis
results.creator_credit: Richard Greenhalgh, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In a special event held at ACMI as part of the ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition, curator Professor Deborah Nadoolman Landis introduced the art of costume design and discussed its role in cinematic storytelling.
Landis, an Oscar®-nominated Hollywood costume designer (‘Raiders of the Lost Ark’, ‘The Blues Brothers’, Michael Jackson’s ‘Thriller’) is also the author of ‘Hollywood Costume’ (2012), the prize-winning exhibition catalogue, and ‘Hollywood Sketchbook: A Century of Costume Illustration’ (2012) among many other volumes.
Landis received her Ph.D. from the Royal College of Art in London and is the Founding Director of the David C. Copley Center for Costume Design at the UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television.

results.title: Peter
results.creator_credit: Martina Amati, James Bolton, Cowboy Films, Film London, Fresh One Productions and Channel 4
results.brief_description: In a semi-empty swimming pool Peter engages in a series of very intense warming up and breathing exercises. He stretches, flexes, inhales and exhales to finally plunge in the water and re-emerges fully satisfied.

results.title: The Estate
results.creator_credit: Caswell Coggins, Mike Carr, Balletboyz, Crossfire and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A short dance piece set in an English housing estate. The choreography is loosely based on the idea of vultures circling a dying animal, feeling their excitement and anticipation as they gather to feed, waiting for the moment to strike.

results.title: Acts of Kindness
results.creator_credit: Michael Landy, Pinky Ghundale, Film London and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A celebration of everyday acts of kindness that happen on London Underground every day of the year. The film originated from ‘Acts of Kindness’, a project by Michael Landy for London Underground, commissioned by Art on the Underground, London Underground Limited, 2011-12.

results.title: Robots of Brixton
results.creator_credit: Kibwe Tavares, Factory Fifteen and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Brixton has degenerated into a disregarded area inhabited by London’s new robot workforce. When the Police invade the one space the robots call their own, the strained relationship between the two sides explodes into an outbreak of violence echoing that of 1981.
